question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetTokenIssuerAndOwnerModificationEnabled()] [Toggle Race Condition] Can attacker time modification to occur while enabled/disabled state is toggling? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetMaxBatchApproveCount()] [Retroactive Change] If max count is reduced, are existing batch approvals over new limit still valid? (Low)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetMaxBatchApproveCount()] [Zero Value] No check preventing input.Value = 0, can this DOS all batch approvals? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: ExtendSeedExpirationTime()] [Backward Extension] No check that input.ExpirationTime > current time - can attacker set expiration to past effectively destroying seed? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: ExtendSeedExpirationTime()] [Owner Authorization Only] Only checks tokenInfo.Owner == Context.Sender at line 703, but what if Owner changes after seed creation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: ExtendSeedExpirationTime()] [Integer Overflow] input.ExpirationTime could be long.MaxValue causing overflow in time comparisons? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: ExtendSeedExpirationTime()] [Missing Validation] No validation that symbol is actually a seed NFT before extending expiration? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetSymbolAlias()] [Chain Restriction Bypass] Hard-coded check for AELF chain at line 744, but can side chains manipulate Context.ChainId to bypass? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetSymbolAlias()] [Alias Permanence] Assert at line 750 prevents setting alias twice, but can this DOS legitimate alias updates? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetSymbolAlias()] [Authorization Bypass] Checks Owner OR Issuer at line 760, but can malicious issuer set alias against owner's wishes? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetSymbolAlias()] [JSON Injection] ExternalInfo value at line 763-764 constructs JSON manually - can input.Symbol/Alias contain quotes breaking parsing? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: SetSymbolAlias()] [Collection Symbol Extraction] GetNftCollectionSymbol at line 747 may fail for certain symbol formats - can this cause DOS? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: CheckTokenAlias()] [Separator Injection] If alias contains NFTSymbolSeparator character, can split at line 848 cause incorrect validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: AddToTransferBlackList()] [Controller Compromise] AssertControllerForTransferBlackList at line 856 - can attacker gain control to blacklist legitimate users? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: AddToTransferBlackList()] [Permanent Blacklist] No automatic removal mechanism - can mistakenly blacklisted address never recover? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: BatchAddToTransferBlackList()] [Duplicate Addresses] Distinct() at line 874 removes duplicates, but can attacker still DOS with max-size arrays of duplicates? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: BatchAddToTransferBlackList()] [Array Size Attack] No max size check on input.Addresses - can attacker submit huge array causing OOM or timeout? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: BatchAddToTransferBlackList()] [Partial Validation] All addresses validated at lines 868-871 before any are added - but if one is invalid, no addresses are added even if others are valid? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: RemoveFromTransferBlackList()] [Parliament Only] Requires Parliament controller at line 887, but can this cause delayed response to emergencies? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: RemoveFromTransferBlackList()] [False Removal] Sets value to false at line 889 but doesn't delete key - can this cause gas inefficiency or state bloat? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: BatchRemoveFromTransferBlackList()] [Array Size DOS] Same issue as BatchAdd - no max size validation on input.Addresses array? (Medium)
